newsitem.title: UK: Romania's Renel plans $100 million bond issue.
newsitem.headline: Romania's Renel plans $100 million bond issue.

text.p: Romanian electricity authority Renel plans to raise $100 million in the international bond markets, an official at Merrill Lynch said on Thursday.
Merrill Lynch is lead manager of the deal, expected to be a five-year floating-rate note private placement.
Dealers said there could be a put after three years.
"The structure is not finalised yet. Roadshows have been held in Asia, but the timing is not yet clear because it is a private placement," the Merrill Lynch official said.
The next public Eurobond by a Romanian borrower was likely to be for state bank Banca Comerciala Romana which announced plans for a deal last year.
It is due to issue a Eurobond for between $75 million and $100 million at three years, also via Merrill Lynch. Roadshows were likely to start within the next few weeks, dealers said.
Also in the pipeline are deals for the cities of Bucharest, Constanta and Brasov.
The Romanian government, which first tapped the bond markets in June 1996 with a $225 million three-year Eurobond, said in December it needed nearly $3.0 billion of external debt.
The central bank would raise loans for up to $1.5 billion and the Finance Ministry would raise the rest.
"Romania is actively looking at the market, but have not decided which currency to tap," said a syndicate manager at a European bank. "They may opt for a five-year dollar deal."
